intro: Barkhausia taraxacoides, commonly known as the African dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped, hairy leaves and its yellow composite flowers that bloom in spring. The plant is adapted to arid environments, with a deep taproot system that allows it to survive in dry conditions. Its leaves are often mistaken for dandelions due to their similar appearance, but it belongs to the Asteraceae family. Barkhausia taraxacoides is also known for its medicinal properties, used traditionally in treating various ailments.
